Dear Ms. McClain:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
•
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4407 (1) Facility and premises maintenance.
Section (1) A facility and premises shall be maintained in a clean, comfortable,
Description and safe condition. The facility shall be located on land that is properly
drained
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/20/22, youth took a bottle of sanitizer out of the supply closet
that is behind locked doors. It is unknown how he accessed without
staff knowledge. Youth hid this inside tampon box in the bathroom. On
12/21/22, youth consumed the sanitizer and became intoxicated. Youth
was taken to the hospital and has been discharged.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
22, 2022, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
he has been at the facility for about 18 days and was placed there to
work on his substance abuse issues. Youth A reported he does not
want to be clean from substances. Youth A reported he asked Staff 1 to
get a game for him in the activity closet, as this door was locked, and
youth has to ask permission to obtain items from the closed. He
reported within the activity closet there is another door where the staff
keep cleaning supplies and items the youth cannot have. Youth A
reported Staff 1 unlocked and open the activity closet door. He reported
he went into the activity closet with Staff 1 to get a game. Youth A
reported he noticed the door to the supply room was open and he
distracted Staff 1 by asking for a game so that he could get two bottles
of hand sanitizer. Youth A reported while Staff 1 was distracted he
grabbed two bottles of hand sanitizer and put it in his pants waist band
and immediately asked to go use the bathroom. Youth A reported he
drank one bottle of the hand sanitizer in the bathroom on December 20,
2022 and hid the other bottle in the bathroom. He reported on
December 21, 2022, he went to the bathroom and drank the other
bottle of hand sanitizer. Youth A reported he hid the hand sanitizer in a
bin so that staff would not notice it. Youth A reported on December 21,
2022, Supervisor and Staff 7 noticed Youth A smelled like alcohol and
gave him a breathalyzer. Youth A reported he then was taken to the
hospital and was cleared. Youth A reported he drank the hand sanitizer
to get drunk not because he wanted to hurt himself. He reported he is
frustrated with being at placement being on at-risk status. Youth A
reported with his status he does not go off grounds and staff keep an
extra eye on him. He reported staff do a good job at supervision of the
youth and reported he is just very manipulative and planned this
situation out.
4

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he
was recently employed at this facility less than 30 days ago and just
completed his training shadow shifts. He reported he has been working
with getting to know the youth one on one. On December 20, 2022,
Youth A had asked him to go into the activity closet to get a game. Staff
1 reported he unlocked the activity closet door and began to look on the
shelves for the game. He reported Youth A was also in the activity
closet during that time. While looking for the game Youth B asked Staff
1 a question and he reported his back was turned for a couple of
seconds. Once the game was found, Staff 1 and Youth A exited the
activity closet, closed the door, and made sure it was locked. Staff 1
reported Youth A did not look like he had anything extra in his pockets.
Youth A was at the milieu tables for about 30 minutes. Staff 1 reported
he did not notice if the supply closet door in the activity closet was open
or closed. He reported during his training he was taught that the door to
the supply closet should be closed and locked at all times. Staff 1
reported he heard later Youth A had snuck into the supply closet while
Staff 1’s back was turned and grabbed hand sanitizer bottles. Staff 1
reported he never heard or saw Youth A walk out of the supply closet,
never noticed he had been hiding anything or that he was ever
intoxicated. Staff 1 reported he felt that he was manipulated and taken
advantage of as he was a new staff member and feels horrible about
the situation.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 22, 2022, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported when he worked on December 21, 2022, Youth B
disclosed to him Youth A had snuck hand sanitizer out of the supply
closet and been drinking it to get drunk. After the disclosure Supervisor
checked the bathroom after Youth A had used it. He found there was
two empty 16.9oz hand sanitizer bottles hidden in a tampons box.
Supervisor reported he met with Youth A with Staff 3 and could smell
alcohol off of Youth A’s breathe. Youth A was confronted and at first
denied that he was drinking the hand sanitizer. A breathalyzer was
given to Youth A, and he blew a .09 and then admitted to drinking the
bottles of hand sanitizers. Supervisor reported nursing was contacted
and Youth A was brought to the hospital to be checked over.
Supervisor reported Youth A reported he drank the bottles not to harm
himself but to meet his urges of wanting to use substances. He
reported Youth A did not disclose how he got the bottles. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 was hired a couple of weeks ago and recently finished
his shadow shifts. He reported there has been no concerns with Staff
1’s ability to care for the youth. Supervisor reported Youth A is on at-
risk status and reported that means Youth A receives normal
programing, but staff are to document more frequent on Youth A’s
4

mood and behavior. Supervisor reported this also means staff are to
keep a closer eye on the youth when out of the milieu area. He reported
Youth A has no specific safety plan for staff to follow at this time.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
22, 2022, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B
reported Youth A asked him if he wanted to get drunk with him since he
stole two bottles of hand sanitizer. Youth B reported he did not want to
ruin his sobriety and was concerned about Youth A, so he told
Supervisor. He reported on December 20, 2022, he was talking with
Staff 1 while Staff 1 was in the activity closet with Youth A. Youth B
reported he saw Youth A sneak in the supply closet and put hand
sanitizer in his pants waistband. Youth B reported he was not purposely
distracting Staff 1 from the situation but just asked him a question. He
reported no youth is supposed to enter the activity closet without staff
supervision and staff need to unlock the activity closet for the youth to
gain access. He reported typically the supply closet that is located in
the activity closet is always closed, or staff are right there when they
are doing a cleaning day. Youth B reported staff do a good job at
supervising the youth and Youth A is just sneaky and doesn’t want to
work the program.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 22,
2022, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he
worked on December 21, 2022 and was notified Youth A had drank
hand sanitizer. He reported he did not have much involvement within
this situation and only checked on Youth A while they were contacting
his parent and probation officer before going to the hospital. Staff 2 was
asked about the activity closet and reported a youth should not be in
that closet without staff supervision and the activity closet is locked. He
reported there is a supply closet within the activity closet that should
always be closed and locked so that only staff can enter with a key.
Staff 2 reported he does not have concerns with other staff’s ability to
supervise the youth. He reported Staff 1 is a newer staff and is still
learning but understands the basic policies within the unit as he just
completed shadow shifts.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 22,
2022, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he
worked both on the mornings of December 20, 2022, and December
21, 2022. He reported there was no major concerns with Youth A
during those days besides on December 21, 2022, he had to be
redirected for making in appropriate hand gestures. Staff 3 reported on
December 21, 2022, Supervisor asked him for support confronting
Youth A due to concerns of Youth A drinking hand sanitizer. Staff 3
reported Youth A admitted to drinking the hand sanitizer but would not
4

disclose how he got the bottles. He reported Youth A is on an at-risk
status meaning there is extra documentation to be done at least every
hour on Youth A because of concerns of self-harm and history of
suicidality. Staff 3 reported Youth A noted he drank the hand sanitizer
to meet his urges not to harm himself. He reported for a youth to get
into the activity closet staff would need to let the youth in and should be
supervising that. Staff 3 reported there is a supply closet within the
activity closet that should remain closed and locked. He reported he
has no concerns with staff’s level of supervision on the unit. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 is a brand-new staff that is also still learning but has no
concerns with Staff 1’s ability to meet the job requirements.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 22,
2022, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she
worked on December 20, 2022. She reported Youth A was in a pretty
good mood that day and did not appear to be intoxicated. She reported
she did get a smell of hand sanitizer at one point during the day but did
not think of anything of it. Staff 4 reported youth need to be let into the
activity closet and be supervised to get an item. She reported there is a
supply closet within that area and that door should be shut and locked
so a youth cannot get in there. She reported within the supply closet is
where cleaning supplies are kept.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported he
worked on December 20, 2022, and December 21, 2022 during the
afternoon shift. He reported on December 20, 2022, he took Youth A to
the gym with some other youth, and everything appeared to be fine and
there were no concerns. Staff 5 reported for the activity closet, the door
should be locked and always closed unless a staff member is getting an
item for a youth. He reported youth should never be in there alone and
the supply closet located within that room should have the door always
closed and locked. Staff 5 reported if he went into the activity closet and
saw the door to the supply closet was open, he would close it. He
reported he has no concerns with other staff’s level of supervision with
the youth on this unit.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported he
does not remember what day he was working but does not remember
ever seeing Youth A intoxicated. He reported he heard about the
situation from the team that Youth A drank hand sanitizer. He reported
he does not know how Youth A got the hand sanitizer as it is kept within
the supply closet. Staff 6 reported the supply closed is a locked room
located within the activity closet that has a note on the door that it
4

should be always closed. Staff 6 reported the activity closet is locked as
well.
Staff 7 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 3,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Staff 7 reported he
worked on December 21, 2022, and worked with Youth A during their
group recovery session. He reported he noticed a smell of liquor
coming off Youth A and that was about the same time Supervisor asked
for Youth A to complete a breathalyzer. Staff 7 reported he later found
out Youth A had stolen and drank hand sanitizer. He reported he does
not know how Youth A got this but reported Youth A can be
manipulative. Staff 7 reported the hand sanitizer is in the storage closet
that is in the activity closest and should always be closed.
Therapist was interviewed via phone on January 3, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS Worker. Therapist reported Youth A
has a history of suicidal ideation and substance use. She reported he is
very open and honest within therapy sessions and reported he drank
the hand sanitizer for the alcohol not for self-harm purposes. She
reported Youth A can be “gamey” at times and will guilt trip others into
getting what he wants. He will gain trust with others and use them for
his own gain.
Conference call was held with MDHHS Worker on January 18,
2023. MDHHS worker reported there are no findings to their
investigation.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on January 3, 2023, in collaboration
with the MDHHS Worker. The activity closet was viewed and on the
front of the door there was a sign. The sign stated, “The door must
remain closed and lock at all times. Client’s are not allowed in the
storage room or janitor closet without staff present. Only staff should
retrieve bedding or client supplies for clients.” The activity door had to
be opened by staff to be allowed access. Within the activity closet was
another door to the storage/janitor’s closet that was closed and locked.
This area was where the hand sanitizer was kept and since moved.
When the area of the supply closet was viewed, it was reported the
hand sanitizer was located near the doorway.
Documents Reviewed:
- MiSACWIS Incident Report number 146430196 and facility
incident report dated December 22, 2022- This report was
consistent with Supervisor interview.
- Wedgwood’s Suicide Precaution Observation log dated
December 19, 2022 - December 22, 2022- Youth A was put-on
4

at-risk status on December 8, 2022 and has maintained this
status. Youth A was put onto At-Risk due to history of self-harm
and suicidal comments. The documentation log notes staff
completing appropriate timely checks on Youth A. It was noted
on December 19, 2022, Youth A’s suicidal ideation diminished
more and maintained a supervision level of every hour
documentation while in area around staff and every 15-mintues
when not in eyesight of staff. Staff completed all appropriate
documentation timely and noted no concerns until Supervisor
had concerns of intoxication on December 21, 2022.
- Wedgwood At Risk Policy- If youth is within their room or out of
staff eyesight staff should be completing 15 minutes checks. If
youth is in continue eyesight, staff may continue to record
behavioral observation at up to one-hour intervals.
- Wedgwood Client Safety Policy- Staff members are
responsible to provide direct ongoing supervision of clients at all
times except authorized by program policies or rules. Staff
members must be informed of and adhere to supervision
procedures of the programs they work in and any modification of
safety-related supervision pertaining to individual clients.
- HR file and Training Log for Staff 1- Staff 1 has no disciplinary
actions noted within his HR file. Staff 1 is up to date on all
required training.
- Email from Youth A’s Probation Officer dated January 3,
2023- Youth A’s probation officer reported Youth A is fairly new
to the program and she has no major concerns with the program
that should be noted.
Analysis The facility has been keeping hazardous items from youth located
behind two locked doors, the activity closet and supply closet. Staff 1
did unlock the activity closet on the date of incident and went into this
area with Youth A to get a game. Staff 1 reported he did not notice the
supply closet being open while in the closet with Youth A. The facility is
found in noncompliance as it was found the door was opened to the
supply closet where hazardous items are kept from youth and Youth A
was able to get access to the hand sanitizer due to this door being
open.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the that the current license status be continued
